name: Ibis London Wembley

reviews.text: We stayed here after the Concert for Diana on July 1st. After a few problems getting to Wembley from central London on the tube(Bakerloo line was closed - didn't realise how much close the train station would have been anyway!) we got there for 12 on the dot (check in time). It was getting fairly busy but I don't feel that that was an excuse for the rudeness of the front desk staff who slammed down a form to fill in without so much as a hello. They then disappeared for a while, then came back and said 'Sit down for 20 mins, there's no rooms ready' - no sorry or please or anything!!
reviews.title: Fantasic location, customer service not great

reviews.text: Anyway we got to our room in the end which was absolutely fine - no complaints. A good size, very clean and a great view of the stadium.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast in the morning was another disappointment though. We got there in plenty of time but already they had run out of several things including croissants, tea, glasses and cereal bowls. When I went to ask if there were more bowls I got a very brusque reply that they knew all about it. Also there was only one toaster for a hotel with 14 floors!! There was quite a long queue for toast! But again, the restaurant was very clean.
reviews.title: OK for a nights stay.
Stay well away!
reviews.text: The hotel is ideally situated for the stadium - it took us no time to get there at all. All in all, if I was going to another event at Wembley I would stay here again, as it's clean and reasonably priced, and so close. Unfortunately I think the location may be used as an excuse for less-than-great customer service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Ibis Wembley on Monday 18th June as we were going to the Arena to see Pearl Jam. For events at the Stadium or Arena, the Ibis is perfectly located, literally a few minutes away (we didn't realise this at first and took a very long, pointless detour!).
reviews.title: Excellent location - great value

likes.disliked: — Waiting time at the bar - simply not staffed enough to cope with demand when there is an event at Wembley

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here overnight when up in Wembley for Dolly Parton. At the budget price its difficult to fault the Ibis for one night. Recommended.
reviews.title: Fine for an overnight stay

likes.liked: — cleanliness and proximity to Wembley Arena

reviews.text: Stayed at the IBIS due to its location close to the train station and arena for a concert. Its a 5 minute walk from the Arena and 2 minutes from the stadium. Right next to the Marylebone train line too which is great.
reviews.title: Great location

likes.liked: — Great location and value for money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean and comfortable with a great shower! Will stay again as its great value for money!
reviews.title: Did the job for us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Ibis Wembley for a night as we went to a concert at the arena. The hotel is fine, ideally located for both stadium and arena events, about 10-15mins walk from Wembley Park tube. Our room was on the 13th floor and quiet with a good view. Couldnt get the air conditioning in the room to work but this wasnt a major problem. The bed was large and comfy, bathroom was clean and the shower was good. The only issue we had was when the reception staff tried to re-charge us more for our nights stay without a sensible explanation. This issue was resolved and the staff helpfully called us a taxi to the tube station as it was pouring with rain outside.
reviews.title: Good value for money!

likes.liked: — Near to Wembley Stadium and Arena

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all if you are going to wembley for an event then the Ibis will do the job.
reviews.title: Good value and great location.

likes.disliked: — Rabble of football fans watching TV in the lobby.

reviews.text: Excellent Hotel! Good value for money!
reviews.title: a little out of the way

description: Ibis London Wembley is located close to Wembley Stadium. Aside from magnificent views of London, the hotel offers easy access to the English capital, only 15 min from Baker Street and 25 min from Oxford Circus on the tube. Book one of our 210 rooms with air cooling system, Complimentary Tea & Coffee, Hair Dryer, In Room Telephone, Pay TV, Internet & WI-FI facility, On-suite Showers & Toilets. Special need rooms are available on request with limited mobility and benefit from the use of our amenities including a restaurant, a bar serving snacks 24 hours 7 days. Discounted Car Parking Facility within 5 min walk in the public car park.
